law.catch_line: Cabinet may establish benchmarks for performance measurement -- Monitoring by Division of Forestry.

text.section: The Division of Forestry, with assistance from the Cabinet for Economic Development, may monitor changes in patterns of wood utilization. Information used in determining changes in wood utilization may include: time-series data on the amount of raw timber shipped out of the state in relation to the amount of timber harvested in the state; time-series data on the number of persons employed in the primary and secondary wood products sectors; and time-series data on value-added measures of Kentucky's forest products. This information may be collected and maintained and may be used to monitor the development of the state's secondary wood industry.

law.history: Amended 2013 Ky. Acts ch. 49, sec. 8, effective June 25, 2013. -- Created 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 224, sec. 13, effective July 15, 1994.
